I did do a quick google translate and based on that perhaps the following will help https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202 (scroll down to "SMTP does not work") Google TRANSLATION follows: Hello good. I'm having a problem with a Microsoft 365 for business account.

It does let me read emails and it syncs fine, but it won't let me send them. I get the error: "Login to 'Microsoft 365' account failed. The login to the server smtp.office365.com with the username xxx@xx.es has failed."

If I hit retry, it comes back out. If I click on change password, this message appears again and if I click on cancel, the following message appears: "Message sending error. Sending the message failed. Unable to identify outgoing (SMTP) server smtp.office365.com. Check the password and check the 'Identification method' in 'Account settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'."

The password is correct. I have tried to eliminate it in the thunderbird options and then when I click to send the email it asks me for the password and to perform Microsoft two-step authentication. It authenticates me correctly but after a few seconds I get that login error message again. I have changed the password in Microsoft, I have deleted it in thunderbird, I have logged in again and nothing. All equal.

The configuration is correctly detected by Thunderbird when I select the IMAP mail mode. The configuration is the following for the outgoing mail server: Server name: smtp.office365.com Port: 587 Connection security: STARTTLS Authentication method: OAut2 Username: my well-written email.

Within Microsoft settings (I'm the administrator), I have the Authenticated IMAP and SMTP option enabled. In the Azure configuration, I have the application correctly created, with its ID and the 4 permissions it asks for have been approved at the administrator level. In the connection log of that application, it appears that I have been logged in correctly when Thunderbird asks me for the credentials.

I'm running out of ideas. I have contacted Microsoft support but they tell me that they do not support other applications and that I should look for my life (with kinder words). What else can I look at, what else can I check?

I would appreciate some help and many thanks in advance :D

content:
Hi again

> I did not delete any individual emails or any of the sub-folders (under my Inbox). ATT had me delete the whole account

Is the following summary corrrect? 1. your email was setup in IMAP 2. you created subfolders of your inbox 3. you deleted your IMAP account on ATT's server 4. You created a new POP Account in Thunderbird

a) Did you create a new Thunderbird profile (docs on profiles: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles ) at any stage in this process?

b) Is the POP account part of the a new Thunderbird profile or old Thunderbird profile?

My guess (and it's only a guess because email servers are varied in how they are implemented and when you deleted your IMAP account is ATT's email server might have deleted your IMAP email in Thunderbird ) is that you might have your inbox subfolder email in your Thunderbird profile in the IMAP section of the profile. assuming you didn't delete your Thunderbird profile as well.

Please check your your inbox in the IMAP section of your Thunderbird profile. It might also be in the Trash folder in the IMAP section of your profile.

Cheers! ...Roland

content:
Hi hospedagenscocar

My apologies but I can only offer support in English.

Google Translate:

When migrating a site, I made backups of the server's e-mails. I created the same accounts on the new Server and with the same passwords. I changed the DNS to the new server (thinking about uploading the emails from my machine to the new provider). As the settings were identical, there was an overlap of the old provider's emails and I lost everything. Is there a way to recover the emails from the old provider in a Thunderbird folder?

My Answer in English

>1. When migrating a site, I made backups of the server's e-mails. Perhaps you can get the missing email from the backup? Or switch the DNS back to the old server, get the email and copy the old emails to a Thunderbird local folder and switch the DNS back to the new server?

>2. Is there a way to recover the emails from the old provider in a Thunderbird folder?

If you saved the email to a local folder on Thunderbird you can get the email from TB's local folder

If you didn't then: I believe that if you use IMAP and the email is not on the new server then when the new server connects it will erase the old email in Thunderbird's IMAP folders. This is how IMAP works; this not a Thunderbird issue.

Hope that helps a wee bit! ...Roland

content:
Hi dravafox:

1. Did you happen to take a screenshot of the "red message"? Would be helpful to see that.

2. Do use anti-virus or 3rd party software? Or add-ons? If you can recall what you have installed that would be great too. And pasting the output of about:support would be great

3. The following suggestion from ace volunteer jscher2000 might help too:

Finding/Using Shadow Copies

You can use a utility program to search inside restore points to try to locate an old file that's usable. (Please do NOT try to use the built-in Windows System Restore for this because you probably would lose data.) Here are the steps:

(1) Set Windows to show hidden files and folders:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/14201/windows-show-hidden-files

(2) Download and run one of these two programs:

  • ShadowExplorer: http://www.shadowexplorer.com/
  • System Restore Explorer: http://nicbedford.co.uk/software/systemrestoreexplorer/

Within the most recent restore point shown in the program, you can explore along this path to see whether you can find a shadow copy of your profile:

\Users\your-user-name\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\

(3) Check in the bookmarkbackups folder of each profile for older backups. You can export interesting files to a convenient location such as your currently live desktop.

If you find a promising candidate, check out this article: Restore bookmarks from backup or move them to another computer -- you'll use the Choose File option at the bottom of the Restore menu to grab the file you exported.

Any luck?

content:
Hi jvh24521

If earlier solutions from others don't work then:

First, I would try upgrading to 77.0.1 which was released yesterday.

Second, try turning off DNS over HTTPS (DoH) (it seems like it fixed the problem for some folks in bug 1637512). You can disable DoH in your Firefox connection settings: using the following instructions which are from https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-dns-over-https#w_manually-enabling-and-disabling-dns-over-https  :

  1. about:preferences#general
  2. In the {menu General} panel, scroll down to Network Settings and click the {button Settings‚Ä¶} button.
  3. In the dialog box that opens, scroll down to Enable DNS over HTTPS.
    • Off: Deselect the Enable DNS over HTTPS checkbox turn it off
  4. Click OK to save your changes and close the window.

Cheers!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

  1. about:preferences#general
  2. In the {menu General} panel, scroll down to Network Settings and click the {button Settings‚Ä¶} button.
  3. In the dialog box that opens, scroll down to Enable DNS over HTTPS.

content:
Hi Cris:

Did you try the following steps from https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-firefox-stores-user-data#w_finding-your-profile-without-opening-firefox?

  1. Click the Finder icon in the dock. On the menu bar, click the Go menu, hold down the option or alt key and select Library. A window will open containing your Library folder.
  2. Open the Application Support folder, then open the Firefox folder, and then the Profiles folder.
  3. Your profile folder is within this folder. If you only have one profile, its folder would have "default" in the name.

Does that help find the profile?

..Roland

content:
For those who didn't click on cor-el's link (thanks as always to cor-el for linking), please see: What you need to know about Twitter on Firefox


QUOTE

Second, why is this just Firefox? The technical details are complicated but the high level is pretty simple: caching is complicated and each browser behaves somewhat differently; with the particular way that Twitter had their site set up, Chrome, Safari, and Edge don‚Äôt cache this data but Firefox will. It‚Äôs not that we‚Äôre right and they‚Äôre wrong. It‚Äôs just a normal difference in browser behavior. There is a standard way to ensure that data isn‚Äôt cached, but until recently Twitter didn‚Äôt use it, so they were just dependent on non-standard behavior on some browsers.


END QUOTE

Cheers! ...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi moviecam:

I have 3 Macs and 3 Windows computers, sounds like you have 2 Macs. Is that right?

I've never actually done this i.e. the manual restore from a backup on Mac or Windows of sqlite files. I just use Firefox Sync with the computers that are working. i.e. when I run into issues (which is what once or twice in over 10 years?) I do the following

1. Make sure the computer(s) that are working are syncing with Firefox Sync 2. Firefox Refresh on the computer that isn't working 3. Login into Sync and wait and few moments on the computer in #2 and then usually everything is back to normal on computer in #2.

Perhaps that will help?

If not the profiles are identical in terms of which files are in which directory (obviously Mac uses "/" instead of "\") on Mac and Windows, and perhaps the Mac specific version of the article that jscher2000 mentioned will be helpful

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/recovering-important-data-from-an-old-profile#firefox:mac:fx73

Cheers!

...Roland

Hi all

As per https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1618277#c4 :

in my testing of other browsers: https://www.maine.gov/geolib/ediscovery/site/index.html

  1. works on Windows 10, Edge Legacy (i.e. non Chrome version of Edge)
  2. doesn't work on Windows 10, Chrome 80
  3. works on OSX Catalina, Safari 13.0.5
  4. doesn't work on OSX Catalina, Chrome 80

which leads me to conclude that this is not a Firefox specific problem (it's a problem that should be fixed of course :-) ! not sure if should be fixed by the Firefox and Chrome browser teams or by the team that coded the map on maine.gov)

content:
Hi 2g01UviG

My apologies if you have tried any of the following

  1. First, the obvious: if you haven't tried this already: have you turned your computer off and then on again. Often Windows computers mysteriously :-) work after that.
  2. Have you tried turning off your firewall? Your home firewall may block things that aren't blocked at work.
  3. If you are using WiFi have you tried using a wired connection? If you are using a wired connected, have you tried WiFi?
  4. any log output in the web console? If so please paste it into a reply here! You can access the web console by using the shortcut "Control Shift K". Full info: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Web_Console/Opening_the_Web_Console

Hope some of the above helps, if not, please let us know!

Cheers!

...Roland

Hi cindyjv

It appears you are running Windows Server 2008 which is no longer supported by Firefox ESR (currently ESR60) or the normal version of Firefox (currently Firefox 63.0.3) ESR 52 was the last release of Firefox ESR to support Windows Server 2008.

https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/enterprise/

I recommend upgrading to a supported version of Windows ) i.e. Windows 7, 8 and 10) that runs ESR 60 or Firefox 63: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/60.0esr/system-requirements/

content:
Hi DeanA320

Metacritic is doing something funky with trackers. Firefox 63 blocks some content trackers by default (and Firefox 62 doesn't block those trackers)

I was able to get metacritic to work in Firefox 63.0.3 by turning off the default-new-to-63-content-blocking:

1. about:preferences#privacy 2. Making sure "All Detected Trackers" is not checked 3. and by enabling auto-play: 4. about:config Set media.autoplay.default to 2 and allowing auto-play on metacritic.com <---- this about:config stuff is brittle and might break in a future release

Hope that helps!

....Roland

content:
Hi davidjfay:

You should be able to restore your bookmarks from the 11-01 backup or the 10-30 backup as per:

[A] https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/restore-bookmarks-from-backup-or-move-them#w_restoring-from-backups

See Note 1 at the end which is a copy and paste of the instructions from [A]

Cheers !

...Roland

Note 1

Caution: Restoring bookmarks from a backup will overwrite your current set of bookmarks with the ones in the backup file.

Click the Library icon , then click Bookmarks. Scroll to the bottom and click Show all Bookmarks.
.
In the Library window, click the Import and Backup button and then select Restore..
.
Select the backup from which you want to restore, in your case either the 11-01 or 10-30 backup:.
.
The dated entries are automatic backups..
Choose File... lets you restore from a manual backup.
.
After choosing a backup, your bookmarks from that file will be restored. Close the Library window.

content:
Hi hemmisey

I believe jscher's response in another thread about warningonquit is what you are looking for:

QUOTE

You should not need to crash Firefox to restore a session.

Firefox 63 doesn't have the browser.showQuitWarning preference any more, meaning Firefox will automatically save your session (assuming it is not set to clear history) and then executes your choice of startup behaviors:

(A) Optional/manual session restore (menu):

  • menu button > Restore Previous Session
  • (menu bar) History > Restore Previous Session

With this approach, you choose whether to restore your previous session at startup instead of at the previous shutdown.

(B) Automatic session restore (Options page):

  • Windows: "3-bar" menu button (or Tools menu) > Options
  • Mac: "3-bar" menu button (or Firefox menu) > Preferences
  • Linux: "3-bar" menu button (or Edit menu) > Preferences
  • Any system: type or paste about:preferences into the address bar and press Enter/Return to load it

It's the first checkbox on the page ("General" panel), "Restore previous session".

This approach is useful to avoid losing your session by opening/closing Firefox without restoring.

END QUOTE

content:
Hi ongaku, thanks for your patience on this issue

On my Windows 10 computer the following steps (I'm not sure what order I did them in)

1. Windows 10 Settings > Personalization > Colors. Scroll down and select the ‚ÄúDark‚Äù option under the ‚ÄúChoose your app mode‚Äù section. (I've also checked "Automatically pick an accent color from my background")

2. in Firefox about:addons -> Themes, select Default

3. in Firefox about:config set ui.systemUsesDarkTheme to 0 as per the fab jscher's instructions above above. Unfortunately as always changing anything in about:config can lead to things breaking at any moment and there's no real support for about:config changes. But hopefully you can remove the above:config tweak in a future release.

Anyhow the above works for me (see screenshot) and the tab icons are visible and tab text is white. I believe if you "play around" with Windows 10 settings and can figure out how to select the default Firefox theme (not sure why you can't, perhaps it's another Firefox theme you installed or a Firefox add-on you installed; check out 1,2,3 for help on this) you can get something readable and that you like.

Finally copying and pasting about:support into a reply on this thread should help further if the above doesn't work.

Cheers! ...Roland

p.s. over the 9 years i've worked on thunderbird and firefox support, people always have issues with the dark theme on Windows, has it got better? what do people use dark mode for ? i've heard folks use it because of movie editing and photo editing and of course personal preference, my personal preference is all things bright even when editing photos but of course your mileage may vary

Lean Plumb (one of the two trackers you mention) is used to offer up contextual hints (i.e. based on the user's context of using Firefox for Android's features, offer some hints). These hints are not ads and your information is not tracked by Mozilla.

content:
Hi mjpsports:

Sorry to hear about this.

  1. Perhaps the old tabs are in the History Menu (on Windows hit Alt first to see the History menu->Restore Previous Session)?
  2. If not you might be able to get them from your Firefox profile
    1. Type in about:profiles in the address bar, then click Open Folder (Windows) or Show in Finder (Mac). Click on sessionstore-backups and then you will see files ending with ".js" and ".jsonlz4"
    2. Open our amazing volunteer (most of Firefox support is done by volunteers) jscher2000's "Scrounger" website: https://www.jeffersonscher.com/res/scrounger.html and then drag and drop the ".js" and ".jsonlz4" files one a time and you can hopefully retrieve your lost tabs
  3. I figured out the above from: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1182134#answer-1022603

Cheers!

...Roland

content:
Hi Koki45

You can't change colors of the font and background in Firefox for iOS. This is a restriction imposed by Apple on Firefox.

But perhaps the following will help a wee bit:

  • In the iOS Settings app tap Display and Brightness

you can then change the Text Size and turn on Bold Text

  • In the iOS Settings app tap General and then Accessibility

you can then change Zoom, Bold Text, make text Larger

Unfortunately there is no iOS setting for font colour and background.

Cheers!

...Roland

content:
Hello Franos13

"Q: Why can we have access to those files on Windows platform and not on Andro√Ød one ? It will help us to revover the tabs I have lost, right ?"

My attempt at an answer (only a Firefox for Android engineer would know for sure):

a) you don't have access to the files on Android in the same way as you do on Windows; as designed by Google, Android is much more locked down unless you root your Android and install a 3rd party ROM (not for non technical folks, i.e. not recommended)

b) those files don't exist on Android, the profiles for Firefox for Android and the profiles Firefox for Windows use different files and are not comparable

Cheers again!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi UUsername

I read your mind and figured you had tried that add-on and I was right :-)

Seriously, the Firefox for Android team is trying like the Firefox for Mac, Windows and Linux team to figure out the way forward to "square the circle" and have a fast, modern browser with WebExtensions that goes beyond what is possible today with WebExtensions to give Firefox users and developers the extensibility they need.

Theming and general skinning of the FF for Android browser with Webextension add-ons is something the FF for Android team hasn't had the time or resources to consider in detail until now as far as I can tell.

They do know that in order to start the process of "squaring the circle" they have to switch FF for Android add-ons to in 57 to Web Extensions just like FF Desktop. That's all I know :-)

More info here:

  • https://blog.mozilla.org/addons/2017/05/18/compatibility-update-android/
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/Legacy_Firefox_for_Android
creator: rtanglao

content:
More thoughts in English:

From the extra question details I see lots and lots of:

failures: [u'CP+[GFX1-]: ClientLayerManager::BeginTransaction with IPC channel down. GPU process may have died.', u'CP+[GFX1-]:

Another thing I normally suggest is to nuke Flash entirely out of the way with https://helpx.adobe.com/la/flash-player/kb/uninstall-flash-player-windows.html and see if things go better that way.

The video driver is also a bit dated:

driverVersion: 8.632.1.2000

Whereas AMD has Display Driver ver. 8.97.100.11 at http://support.amd.com/es-xl/download/desktop/legacy?product=legacy2&os=Windows+7+-+64

So in summary, I'll suggest to 1) update the video driver, 2) uninstall Flash

Cheers! ...Roland

M√°s Pensamientos en Espa√±ol

De los detalles adicionales de la pregunta veo porciones y porciones de:

Fallos: [u'CP + [GFX1-]: ClientLayerManager :: BeginTransaction con el canal IPC hacia abajo. GPU proceso puede haber muerto. ', U'CP + [GFX1-]:

Otra cosa que normalmente sugiero es nuke Flash completamente fuera del camino con https://helpx.adobe.com/la/flash-player/kb/uninstall-flash-player-windows.html y ver si las cosas van mejor de esa manera .

El controlador de v√≠deo tambi√©n es un poco anticuado:

DriverVersion: 8.632.1.2000

Mientras que AMD tiene Display Driver ver. 8.97.100.11 en http://support.amd.com/es-xl/download/desktop/legacy?product=legacy2&os=Windows+7+-+64

As√≠ que en resumen, voy a sugerir a 1) actualizar el controlador de v√≠deo, 2) desinstalar Flash

"To have Windows always show the keyboard shortcuts next
to menu items for easier learning:

1.  head to the "Ease of Access Center" in Vista's Control

saving your wrist a trip to the mouse or trackpad"

content:
Hi chayada:

Switching languages is done by changing the language in the iOS settings

https://support.apple.com/HT204031 has all the instructions you need

tl;dr; Home Screen -> Settings -> General -> Language and Region -> tap "[Device] Language" | pick the language you want e.g. if you want German then tap "Change to German" and then your device will reset itself and your iPhone/iPad will change to the new language and the next time you start Firefox it will be in that language.

Cheers!

,..Roland

content:
Hi preread:

Here are the instructions from our official documentation: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/open-links-background-later-viewing-firefox-android#w_enable-tab-queuing

  1. Tap the menu button (either below the screen on some devices or at the top-right corner of the browser) and then select Settings (you may need to tap More first) .
  2. Select Customize.
  3. Un-Check the box next to Open multiple links.

Cheers! ...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi lbaileyh99

Here's what you need to know:

  1. Since Amazon wants to change Firefox in ways that we can't accept, Firefox is not available for download in the Amazon App store and Mozilla therefore doesn't officially support Firefox on the Kindle Fire
  2. Instead of using Amazon's app store, you have to download it directly from Mozilla. You can download it from here:
    • https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/channel/#developer

Finally since we don't officially support Amazon tablets and I don't have a Kindle Fire, I've never tried it but others report that it works quite well. Cheers!

....Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi urquattro83:

You wrote: "Does clearing cache re-set syncing to a manual function? "

No it doesn't but perhaps we can help further if you could tell us:

  1. What you were trying to accomplish by clearing the cache?
  2. your android tablet or phone make and model
  3. your version of Firefox for Android. We recommend you use the latest Firefox for Android 42 that was released Tue Nov 3
  4. your android operating system version (e.g. lollipop 5, kitkat 4.3 etc)
  5. what you did, what happened and what happened.

Cheers!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi mrstuartinoz:

There is no need to be disrespectful. Please be civil or we won't be able to help you in the future.

If you referring to this previous question: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1037538 your question was answered by an employee (although our volunteers are equally knowledgeable sometimes more!)

Anyhow Facebook changes their website all the time which breaks Firefox and other software.

In order for us to help you please let us know:

  1. your android tablet or phone make and model
  2. your version of Firefox for Android. We recommend you use the latest Firefox for Android 42 that was released Tue Nov 3
  3. your android operating system version (e.g. lollipop 5, kitkat 4.3 etc)
  4. do you have a 3rd party keyboard like swype installed? sometimes these sorts of things break Firefox
  5. what you did, what happened and what happened. I understand you were simply leaving a Facebook comment but if there are any other details missing please provide them.

Cheers!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi Roger-1


Firefox for iOS version 1.0 doesn't sync bookmarks from Firefox on your computer; just history, passwords and recent tabs.

Firefox for iOS Version 1.1 will add the ability to sync your iOS phone or tablet with the bookmarks from Firefox on your computer. It will be out before the end of the year if things go well (perhaps even sooner!).

Cheers! ...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi nectonblue:

I‚Äôm replying to you because you posted a question about setting a homepage in the last few months.

We‚Äôre testing a homepage feature in Firefox Nightly and we‚Äôd love to get your feedback before we release it to the public!

Here are a few questions we have for you, but please include any other feedback:

  1. Briefly describe what you expected the homepage in Firefox to be like.
  2. How does the homepage in Firefox compare to your expectations?
  3. Is anything missing from the ‚Äòhomepage in Firefox‚Äô experience?
  4. Was it easy or difficult to set your homepage in Firefox?
  5. What is one thing you would change about the homepage in Firefox?

Ready to give it a try? Here‚Äôs how it works:

  1. First, allow third-party app installation on your Android. Go to your Android Settings and enable 'unknown sources' (usually under "Security").
  2. Download and install Firefox for Android Nightly at nightly.mozilla.org
  3. Open Firefox for Android Nightly, then in the menu, tap Settings -> Customize -> Home -> Set a Homepage
  4. Enter a homepage by either typing in a URL, or put a check mark next to ‚ÄòUse current tab‚Äô.
  5. Finally tap ‚ÄòOK‚Äô to set your homepage.

You‚Äôll will see your homepage every time you restart Firefox for Android Nightly.

Cheers!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi Curious2

You can enter the Swedish website URL into Google Translate:

https://translate.google.com/

And then you will get your translation!

I don't know of any other way for Firefox for iOS.

Unfortunately, we don't have add-ons or extensions for Firefox for iOS. The team is trying to figure out an add-on strategy for iOS but has no timeline for this strategy and implementing it.
creator: rtanglao

content:

content:
HI Norman:

There are no folders on Firefox for iOS (or Firefox for Android). Folders for bookmarks are only on Firefox for Mac, Windows and Linux.

This is a long standing feature request that the engineering team is aware of but hasn't yet figured out how and when it will do this.

Cheers!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi Soloeuph

From Firefox for Android you can send video URLs to your Chromecast, here's how:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/use-firefox-android-send-videos-chromecast

There is no Chromecast support in Firefox for Mac, Windows, Linux or iOS

If the above doesn't help please let us know what you did, what happened, and what you expected as well as your device (mac, windows, linux computer model, Android tablet or phone model, iPhone or iPad model) and your device's operating system (e.g. Windows 7, Android Lollipop, iOS 9.0.2, Mc OS X Mavericks 10.10.5 etc)

Cheers!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:

content:
Hi your_mom

"swipe up from home search" is a Google Android operating system feature. It is not a Firefox feature (although we allow you to set Firefox instead of google as the search app that is started by swipe up from home search).

Some versions of Android like HTC allow you to disable "swipe up from home search". Most versions of Android do not; in other words this is a limitation of Google Android not Firefox.

The only workaround I can think of is to set "swipe up from home search" to be Google Now if you are annoyed by Firefox search and aren't annoyed by Google Now.

Cheers!

...Roland

content:
Hi cangreg

Glad you solved your problem.

You can exit Firefox using the normal Android operating system process which is:

  1. tap the soft button next to the home button and then
  2. tap the "X" or swipe left on Firefox
  3. And finally if you don't mind clearing some or all of your data on exit, you can add the exit button back to the Firefox menu by following the instructions here:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-do-i-quit-firefox-android

happy weekend! ...Roland

content:
Hi WhiteBuffalo:

Please be nice to the folks here. Most are volunteers and James is a one of volunteers (thanks James!).

Due to the nature of the Android operating system if your web browser or other app *could* use a permission like camera or geo location in the future, you have to approve those permissions twice:

  1. when installing the app AND
  2. then on any website that uses those permissions, Firefox asks for your permission for that individual websites.

I wish Android was different and you could approve (or deny) those permissions the first time they are used on an individual website (i.e. #2 only) but there's nothing we can do about this.

I've heard that if you root your Android phone (which I don't recommend unless you are technical) that you can control the permissions in the way you want (i.e. through some unsupported third party app, automatically deny and or eliminate the permission request when installing apps).

Cheers!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi Tmiletes

Here's how to do this on a Samunsg S5 (might be slightly different on non Samsung phones)

  1. Open the Android Settings App
  2. Tap on "Application manager"
  3. Tap on "Firefox"
  4. Tap on "CLEAR DEFAULTS"

After you do the above Firefox will no longer be automatically invoked when you long hold the Home buton. Unfortunately on Samsung you can't set "long hold Home" to do nothing so if you don't like Firefox being invoked, you will have to set it to Google or some other app.

Please let us know if that solves your problem!

Cheers!

...Roland

content:
Hi Kristian Roa C.

Thanks for replying!

Just tried all 3 options again (last time was on a Samsung S5) for www.animeid.tv on my HTC One M7 running Android Kitkat 5 & Firefox 36.0.1 and I see the same behaviour as you described

  1. For DailyMotion I think this could be a bug in Firefox or more likely a bug in the way the video player was coded by the animeid web developers since DailyMotion.com videos work fine in fullscreen if you watch them from dailymotion.com
  2. For ios: this is of course coded for iOS (which uses the same browser engine as Chrome) so I am not surprised it doesn't work
  3. For Videobam - I have no idea why it takes so long to load. Might be a bug in Videobam or again the way the web developers have coded it.
  4. "I compare it with chrome android and for my surprise I'm able to watch the videos normally" - This is unfortunately not a surprise; this happens a lot because many mobile sites are coded by web developers to only work on Safari and Chrome and in doing so are not compatible with webstandards (we call this "webcompat"). I would suggest that you file a support request with animeid.tv to fix their coding and also that you file a webcompat issue at https://webcompat.com/
  5. "I have a doubt if Mozilla by default has installed flash player or not. And in the negative case: where can I get the apk?." - You are right, Mozilla doesn't install flash by default. Please install the flash player by following our instructions here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-do-i-watch-flash-videos-firefox-android and here: https://helpx.adobe.com/flash-player/kb/installing-flash-player-android-devices.html

Sorry that I can't give you a definitive solution but hopefully the above will help a wee bit.

Cheers!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi Nov-284

tl;dr:Jscher2000 is right. As of Android 4.4.4 and up, the Google Android Operating System on all devices except HTC devices wants to invoke some sort of app when you press and hold down the home button and there is no way to disable the "press and hold down the home button" functionality.

There are workarounds like deleting all the apps that provide press and hold down home button functionality (like Google Now, Firefox and many other apps) but there is no way on Google "vanilla android" like on Google Nexus Devices and on Samsung devices like the Note 4 and S5 to disable the prompt when pressing and holding down the home button

There is a way to disable the press and home button functionality on HTC Devices (Go to Android Settings|Display, gestures and buttons| Home | tap on "Swipe for Google Now, press and hold for menu".

So you are stuck with press and hold the home button invoking an app unless you switch to HTC or Google or Samsung add a preference to disable it like HTC did.
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi 66Blake:

There is no built-in way to get a home page for Firefox for Android.

There are at least two 3rd party add-ons (please remember that Mozilla doesn't support 3rd party add-ons) that might do what you want:

  1. Home Changer (gives you a home page but doesn't give you access to your bookmarks since it disables about:home) https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/android/addon/home-changer/
  2. Home Button (not a home page but gives you a button for home page access) https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/android/addon/home-button-for-ff-on-android/

Hope that helps!

...Roland

p.s. I know this isn't exactly what you are looking for but pinning the desired sites to your homescreen might be useful: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/use-awesome-screen-search-web-bookmarks-and-more#w_access-your-top-sites

I don't think Firefox for Android will import Opera bookmarks out of the box. The best thing to do is to sync Opera to Opera Desktop and then:

happy monday cc43

I am stumped. I can't reproduce your problem but I wasn't able to follow your steps. Here's what you wrote (and what I did in italics)

content:
Hi Peterson:

Wow! Amazing test! Thanks for taking the time to do this.

I will test Windows 8 + Nexus 7 2013 + Samsung S5 on monday (I don't have any LG phones)

You wrote: "How often is it supposed to sync?" Hmmm unfortunately there is no easy answer to this as far as I can tell! Why is there no easy answer? Because Firefox sync on Android runs when Android sync tells it to run which is not predictable. i.e. it's my understanding that even if you go to Android Settings | Accounts | Firefox and tap 'Sync all' that the sync doesn't happen right away (and not all phones and tablets have 'Sync all' ; it depends on what version of Android and what customizations)

I will double check with a developer and get back to you if my understanding is incorrect!

...Roland

Hi Raghuramkonduru

This is a frequently asked question so I have copied and pasted the following from https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1033325 :

There are no Pop-up Blocker Options in Firefox for Android. However, if you wish to disable Pop-ups, you can follow these instructions:
  1. Type about:config in the address bar
  2. Search for dom.disable_open_during_load and set it to false
To re-enable the Pop-up blocker, set dom.disable_open_during_load to true

Cheers!

content:
Hi olsi:

  • 2. steps to reproduce crash problem as per your screenshots
    • i) highlight text "display the word 'paste'..."
    • ii) copy the text
    • iii) long press on 'Aaa' and then 'Aaa" is selected
    • iv) tap on combined clipboard copy/paste icon and the text 'Aaa' is copied instead the desired behaviour which is to paste "display the word 'paste'..."
  • 3. to fix this, the workaround I believe is to do the following instead of 2 iv):
    • iv) tap on the checkmark icon first to make sure 'Aaa' is not selected and then long press and use the combined clipboard copy/paste icon to paste (or on some devices a Paste icon instead of the combined clipboard copy/paste icon will be shown and you can use this Paste icon). I found this workaround here: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1086933#c7:
"The "Paste" popup is finicky in the URLBar. Because you had a selection already, we show the ActionBar. If you would have cleared the URLBar selection and then long-pressed, you would have seen the "Paste" popup."

Again olsi thanks for your patience and please let us know if the workaround 3 iv) works
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi rcbeeman39:

  1. Some Android devices have a menu button built directly into the device. In these cases, Firefox for Android hides its own menu icon . You can still access the Firefox menu by tapping on the device's menu button OR
  2. The hardware menu button is typically located at the bottom of the device, next to the home, search and navigation buttons.
  3. Full info including screenshots https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-menu-icon-missing-android-how-access-menu
  4. If the above doesn't help please let us know your Android phone or tablet model number (S4? HTC One? etc), Android Operating System version (jellybean 4.1, 4.2, 4.3, kitkat 4.4, lollipop 5.0,e tc) and exactly what you did, what happened and what you expected
  5. Finally there is no supported way to " setup a home page" on Firefox for Android. The unsupported 3rd party add-on Home Changer may work for you: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/android/addon/home-changer/?src=search Also you may find that customizing the start screen may be good enough: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/use-awesome-screen-search-web-bookmarks-and-more

Fingers crossed the above helps a wee bit!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi Kruk07 and hgt43

philipp is right (thanks!) it is not possible to disable the Firefox Search Engine widget from Firefox.

This is a general Android operating system problem with Android widgets; you can't disable or delete an Android widget without uninstalling its application e.g.. you can't disable or delete the Firefox search widget without uninstalling firefox.

Third party solutions like SwipeLaunch Disabler and using a custom ROM or a custom launcher like the Nova Launcher may work but as far as I can tell they don't work well and they don't work on all Android phones.

Hopefully Google will enhance the Android Operating system post 5.0 to fix this issue. Disabling widgets and deleting widgets in Android 5.0 is still not possible.

In the meantime you can try a 3rd party solution or just live with it (and of course file a feature request bug for Firefox but I doubt there's much the Firefox developers can do to fix this.)

happy rest of weekend! ...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi petevdweg

I can send and receive email using gmail and zimbra mail using Thunderbird 31.1.2 on both Mac and Windows.

In order to provide the best possible comments or advice and to save time, the community will need more troubleshooting details (in particular exact error messages if any, your exact Thunderbird settings for sending and receiving email - screenshots preferred; your OS, Thunderbird version and the other details mentioned below). But, I also wanted to suggest these links as we frequently find that problems relate to these issues:

  1. Does Thunderbird work in TB Safe mode? https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/safe-mode
  2. Perhaps your passwords for some reason aren't being recognized? If so try deleting your SMTP password and your incoming (POP or IMAP password) : https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cannot-send-messages
  3. If you are on Windows, please double check that your anti-virus and firewall programs are configured for the version of Thunderbird you are using. Some anti-virus programs require a manual configuration to re-allow Thunderbird after each Thunderbird upgrade. If that doesn't help please try *briefly* turning off anti-virus and see if that helps. More info and some anti-virus workarounds are here: https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Antivirus_Related_Performance_Issues

If the above doesn't help, the community needs more detailed troubleshooting information to help you

Please reply with complete details:

  1. firewall and anti-virus software versions if any,
  2. Operating System (Windows XP?)
  3. ISP, mail service provider,
  4. the output from Thunderbird when you select Help | Troubleshooting Information
  5. what add-ons you have installed if any
  6. exact error message, what you did, what you expected, what happened, etc.
creator: rtanglao

Hi Bruzzzz

By "Galaxy 5", you mean "Galaxy S5" right?

I have a Galaxy S5 and I don't have an issue with logging onto yahoo mail from Canada (I am in Vancouver)

The error message

[error message]: "Firefox has detected that the server is redirecting the request for this address in a way that will never complete."

usually means that there is a DNS problem

I would suggest trying with a known good WiFi connection instead of the WiFi or 3G you are using now. That should fix the above [error message]. Please let us know if this solves the problem

you don't need to close Firefox or any other Androiid App. Android 4.4.2. will automatically close it when needed (and in fact Google recommends that apps don't have an quit option). If you really want to force close it then just go to the Android Settings App and

i) goto the Application Manager ii) scroll down and tap Firefox iii) tap Force Stop

Cheers!

...Roland

content:
Hi SteinebacH:

Are you using F'irefox 28 (which has the "old" sync) or Firefox 29 (which has the "new" sync) '.

Anyhow:

Old sync (FF28 and below):

you can't change your email address but it's not used for much To change your email address with old sync;:

0. Using your old email address, sync all your devices i.e. all your phones and tablets and desktops and laptops) so your everything is up to date

1. unlink all your devices (WARNING: make sure you have synced successfully in step 0!!!!!)

2. then create a new sync account with the new email address and sync to the new

new sync in FF29 and higher

your email address is your userid. you can't change it however you can create a New Firefox Account with the new email address

0. Using your old email address, sync all your devices i.e. all your phones and tablets and desktops and laptops) so everything is up to date

1. Delete your Firefox Account using the old email address (WARNING: before you do this make sure you have synced all of your devices and computers successfully in step 0)

2. Then create a new Firefox sync account with the new email address and sync

content:
Hi again arminus1:

I always think it's fair to think of people and organizations to be innocent until proven guilty. We are as we have always been working on the side of the user as per our manifesto:

https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/about/manifesto/ 

so I would appreciate you giving us a wee bit more the benefit of the doubt especially since there are no documented cases of Mozilla handing over date to governments or compromising user data.

Firefox *does* clear your bookmarks, top sites and history when you clear browsing history. I am aware of the following issues:

  1. If you have a site pinned in your Top Sites, Firefox doesn't unpin pinned Top Sites when you clear history. Pinning a site is a hard feature to discover so I doubt this is your problem. If you have pinned a site, long tap on it in Top Sites to unpin it. This seems like a bug to me. Feel free to file a bug about this at https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/enter_bug.cgi
  2. If for some reason you have Don't keep activities checked in: Android Settings | Developer options then clearing history doesn't work in Firefox for Android. Not sure if this is an Android Operating system bug or a Firefox bug. To fix this issue, simply uncheck "Don't keep activities" and then clearing history in Firefox will work properly. I believe we already have a bug filed about this but there's not much we can do about Android OS. I believe it's a bug to expose this to users. I have personally tested clearing private data and it works fine for me on my Galaxy Note 3 and Nexus 5, 7 and 10.
  3. Finally if there's some other issue around clearing history or private data, i would love to hear it and feel free to file a bug or I will file a bug for you

Cheers! 

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
1. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/986796#answer-535445 answers "Need to permanently remove browsed sites" I believe
  2. Finally "clear history automatically" is not planned. It could be done in an add-on (but I don't know of one that does it) or you could use private browsing or guest browsing both of which don't keep history.

I am locking this question because I think the above answers both those issues.

content:
Hi CCFA and Diego:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-do-i-clear-private-data-firefox-android also covers how to clear all bookmarks.

tl;dr:

  1. Firefox Menu (hardware menu button on Samsung and older devices; "3 dots" soft button on newer devices)
  2. Settings | Privacy | Clear private data | Check all the data you want to clear | Clear Data

Note that this doesn't clear any pinned top sites. You will have to unpin any pinned top sites to get rid of them (from Top Sites long tap on the site you want to get rid of and then tap Unpin Site)

content:
Hi Sir Bry:

1. You wrote: "I found this to be true with skype's video chat camera. It came on all by itself. "

Firefox is not Skype :-) ! We value privacy, it's part of the Mozilla mission as a non profit. The camera is not turned on by Firefox without your permission (from https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-firefox-android-use-permissions-it-requests ) : "Firefox never takes a picture or video unless you ask it to"

2. I have a Nexus 7 2012 with Android 4.3 and it doesn't crash with Firefox 26.0.1 when i send email from yahoo.com with attachments so my (hopefully informed by reason) :-) guess is that the issues you are experiencing are Avast related.

Therefore:

I humbly suggest for a brief test uninstalling avast and seeing if that stops the crashing. if it does please file a support report with avast at their website.

3. In the meantime, thanks for the crash reports Sir Bry! i or somebody else (you can go ahead and file a crash bug report with those crash ids if you know how and can't wait) will file a crash bug report using those crashids!
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi Sir Bry:

Firefox is not snooping on you. It asks you for those permissions because it now allows webapps to use those multimedia capabilities; installing firefox doesn't automatically turn on the microphone or any other feature. If you install Firefox, for those multimedia features like using the microphone, Firefox will still prompt you for permission to use the microphone for those few websites that use the microphone.

As always we strong recommend using the latest version of Firefox (for security and other reasons) which is currently Firefox for Android 26.0.1

What version of Nexus 7? 2012 or 2013?

On my Nexus 7 2012 and 2013 I have no problems with Firefox 26 crashing. It's fine with yahoo, cnn etc

Please let us know which model of Nexus 7 you are using and which sites are causing the crashes.

Cheers!

...Roland

QUOTE

than it's probably a Metro PCS issue because it is possible for your mobile carrier to do things like take over what's displayed when you open Firefox or any other browser. We've had cases of other US mobile carriers changing the home page on Firefox and other Android browsers for example.

If you still get the same Metro PCS issue, does the issue go away when you use another WiFi provider, e.g. at Starbucks?

IF the issue goes away when you use another WiFi provider, it's definitely a Metro PCS issue (in that case please ask Metro PCS support).

content:
Hi praxus07:

Sounds like you have by accident installed the OpenDNS Search Provider as a search engine in Firefox for Android.

If that's the case, here's how to fix the problem:

Delete the OpenSearch search provider as follows:

1. Menu | Settings | Customize | Search settings

2. Long press on "Open DNS" (Open DNS should be at the top followed by Google) and then tap "Remove"

Hope that helps!

Happy Holidays!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi SuperRup91:

As the fantastic jscher2000 wrote: "you may have OpenDNS set as your DNS service in your router, or your ISP may be using it."

And you may not have been aware that OpenDNS was set in your WiFi router.

Whoever controls the network that your WiFi hooks into can change google searches or anything you browse or in this case change "404 page not found errors" to go to OpenDNS. And there are two place where your network is controlled: i) your wifi router and ii) your ISP.

Two examples:

1. Here in Vancouver, Canada where I live, if you connect to a Shaw WiFi hotspot, then Shaw changes your searches by adding Shaw specific stuff. Not a great situation :-) but Shaw does that. (one could argue that this means Shaw is "breaking the internet")

2. By default Verizon configures the WiFi routers they supply with something called "DNS assistance" which changes DNS and again one could argue that this too "breaks the internet"

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/975069#answer-493363
  • https://www.verizon.com/support/residential/internet/fiosinternet/troubleshooting/network/questionsone/99147.htm

Therefore, I recommend you check your WiFi router and see if it has OpenDNS configured. You may have to consult your ISP's technical support to remove OpenDNS; this is most certainly not a Firefox problem; we can't help with WiFi router configuration unfortunately.

Hope that helps!

Happy Holidays!

...Roland
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi oldsalt:

Just realized we had duplicate content and that some of it is out of date.

Clearing cookies, private data, history, and settings in Firefox for Android has the most up to date information on how to clear history as of Firefox 26:

QUOTE

  1. To clear private data, cookies, history and settings in Firefox for Android, tap the Menu button (on some devices this is along the bottom edge of the device, on others it is a software menu on the top right) , then tap Settings (on some devices you may have to tap More first).
  2. Tap Privacy and then tap Clear private data.
  3. Choose the data you want to keep or clear by enabling the check boxes.
  4. Tap Clear data.

END QUOTE

I hope that helps you and others.

Cheers!

...Roland

content:
Hi Jester1111

Sorry to hear about this problem.

Firefox for Android doesn't just switch search providers arbitrarily.

Two guesses:

1) You accidentally or somehow forgot that you installed an add-on that does search on Verizon by default.

  • In the Firefox for Android menu: check Tools | Add-ons and make sure you don't have a Firefox for Android add-on that makes Verizon your search provider or that Verizon is your default search provider.
  • If you do have an add-on related to Verizon, disable it
  • If somehow Verizon became a search provider, long tap on Verizonand tap "Disable"

2) Verizon did something strange. Not sure what they could do and how to cope with it but it's a possibility that your ISP (which I guess is Verizon) can do weird things when connected to the ISP's WiFi.

Followup questions:

  • What Android device are you using?
  • What version of Android are you using?
creator: rtanglao

content:
Hi Rydafromtha253 and cityofulysses:

As of Firefox 20, it is possible to do some Firefox start screen (home page) customization (we just documented it so it's easy to have missed it).

You can: pin a site, remove a site by unpinning it and edit a pinned site's url.

Please read the following Knowledge Base Article for complete information and directions:

Pin Sites on the Firefox for Android start screen

Hope that helps!

content:
Hi again Drdan123

Try forcing an update to FF 19 for Android as follows:

(the following is copied and pasted from: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-android-crashes-startup-how-fix )

  1. Open the Google Play Store application and tap on the search icon which looks like a magnifying glass.
  2. Type "Firefox" and tap on the magnifying glass search icon.
  3. Tap on Firefox and then tap on Update.

hopefully this will result in an upgrade to FF 19 which will fix your problems.

Cheers! ...Roland

content:
Hi Arejfour and jesselbo

I. For AOL and Hotmail, I couldn't reproduce this bug. Please reply with your exact set of steps to reproduce this problem in both AOL and Hotmail (see II. for the detail required for a set of steps to reproduce)

II. However I did find Bug 816073 - Wrongly spelled words not underlined if modifying other words in a sequence

and I can reproduce it from the steps here:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=816073#c0

namely

QUOTE

STR:

Have spell checking enabled

1. Open http://www-archive.mozilla.org/editor/midasdemo/

2. Change font to Arial (couldn't reproduce with the default font)

3. Type "oner twor threer fourr fiverr sicer sevenr"

4. Right click on "fourr" and select a valid word.

Actual result:

The first two misspelled words (oner twor) are not underlined.

Could also reproduce on mail.yahoo.com and gmail.com

END QUOTE

III. Arejfour and jesseblo if you give me a set of detailed steps to reproduce, and it turns out to be a different bug than bug 816073, I will gladly file a bug on your behalf
creator: rtanglao
